column8: http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...oples-hardship/Anwar slams Irwan for denial over people’s hardshipFMT Reporters | January 8, 2017Former opposition leader says Tresury sec-gen's remarks trivialises challenges faced by millions of Malaysians after ringgit's decline and increase in cost of living.PETALING JAYA: Anwar Ibrahim has condemned Treasury secretary-general Irwan Siregar Abdullah over his remarks at a press conference on Thursday that the economy was doing well.Calling it a clear denial of the reality that is facing “millions of Malaysians”, the jailed former opposition leader said the government must stop giving empty assurances about the economy.“Irwan has astonished Malaysians by claiming that the economy is doing well and that it’s all about ‘perception’.“This belies and trivialises the actual challenges faced by millions of Malaysians following the record plummet of the ringgit and the increase in the price of food and commodities since the implementation of the GST,” Anwar, who is currently serving a five-year sentence at the Sungai Buloh Prison, said in a statement released today.Criticising the actions of the Barisan Nasional (BN) government over the past 10 years, in denying the true facts, Anwar said immediate action must be taken to restore the livelihood and hopes of the Rakyat.“Malaysia cannot expect to resolve these issues when the leaders and top bureaucrats are not addressing outstanding economic issues.Last Thursday, at a press conference in Putrajaya, Irwan had said Malaysia’s economy was doing well with an expected annual growth of 4.5% to 5%.“We are targeting a 3.1% deficit and we are on track towards achieving it.“We have all the programmes in place to achieve this so we are on track,” he said at his finance ministry office.When asked to respond on why there were still complaints about the high cost of living if indeed the economy was doing well, he said it was because the alternative media had painted a negative picture of the country’s economy.
